H0.text: Anaerobic environments are where most diplomonads and parabasalids are found.

H1.text: Acidic environments are where most diplomonads and parabasalids are found.

H2.text: Enzymatic is the type of environment in which most diplomonads and parabasalids are found.

H3.text: Skeletal is the kind of environment where most diplomonads and parabasalids are found.

A4.text: Parabasalids are anaerobic, and lack mitochondria, but this is now known to be a result of secondary loss, and they contain small hydrogenosomes which apparently developed from reduced mitochondria.
